name: National Human Trafficking Hotline
description: The National Human Trafficking Hotline is a national, toll-free hotline operated by Polaris and supported by the Administration for Children and Families (ACF) of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. The hotline provides 24/7 confidential assistance to victims and survivors of human trafficking, as well as those who want to report suspected trafficking cases. Highly trained Anti-Trafficking Hotline Advocates are available in more than 200 languages to provide crisis intervention, safety planning, and referrals to local service providers. The hotline serves as a central access point for connecting victims with emergency, transitional, and long-term services across the United States.
source: Verified from official website, U.S. Department of State, Homeland Security, and multiple government sources
hours: 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
eligibility: Available to anyone in the United States
notes: TTY: 711 for hearing or speech impaired. Text 'BEFREE' to 233733. Live chat available on website. In immediate danger, call 911 first. Operated by Polaris Project with federal funding support.
